items.sentence: Tom died before the ambulance could get there.
Tom does much better than Mary does at school.
Why didn\'t you tell me that you were married?
Why don\'t you come over here and sit with me?
There were no railroads in Japan at that time.
Tom left the matter entirely in Mary\'s hands.
I really don\'t want to go to Boston with Tom.
Tom drank the whole bottle of milk by himself.
Tom grew up in the same orphanage as Mary did.
How did you get Tom to give you so much money?
How did you know Tom would be able to help us?
How did your plans to move to Boston work out?
How in the world do you expect me to pay this?
How late did you stay at the party last night?
The concert was short, but it was really good.
I\'m afraid that there isn\'t any coffee left.
I\'m afraid you\'re sitting in the wrong seat.
You\'re lying and you\'re not very good at it.
Tom doesn\'t look like he\'s enjoying himself.
Tom told me he wanted to visit Mary in Boston.
